data.event: Archaeological artefacts discovered in 2007 appeared to indicate that the region around Kediri may have been the location of the Kediri kingdom, a Hindu kingdom in the 11th century.

event.title: was known as the site of classical Javanese culture, particularly between the 10th and 15th centuries

data.event: The Brantas River valley was known as the site of classical Javanese culture, particularly between the 10th and 15th centuries.

event.title: was established by King Airlangga on the banks of the upper Brantas river in 1042

data.event: The town of Kediri was established by King Airlangga on the banks of the upper Brantas river in 1042.

event.title: centuries, control of the city passed

data.event: Over the centuries, control of the city passed to the Singhasari, Majapahit, Demak and Mataram kingdoms.
